31 namespace voxblox {
32 namespace timing {
33 
34 const double kNumSecondsPerNanosecond = 1.e-9;
35 
36 Timing& Timing::Instance() {
37  static Timing t;
38  return t;
39 }
40 
41 Timing::Timing() : maxTagLength_(0) {}
42 
43 Timing::~Timing() {}
44 
45 // Static functions to query the timers:
46 size_t Timing::GetHandle(std::string const& tag) {
47  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(Instance().mutex_);
48  // Search for an existing tag.
49  map_t::iterator i = Instance().tagMap_.find(tag);
50  if (i == Instance().tagMap_.end()) {
51  // If it is not there, create a tag.
52  size_t handle = Instance().timers_.size();
53  Instance().tagMap_[tag] = handle;
54  Instance().timers_.push_back(TimerMapValue());
55  // Track the maximum tag length to help printing a table of timing values
56  // later.
57  Instance().maxTagLength_ = std::max(Instance().maxTagLength_, tag.size());
58  return handle;
59  } else {
60  return i->second;
61  }
62 }
63 
64 std::string Timing::GetTag(size_t handle) {
65  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(Instance().mutex_);
66  std::string tag;
67 
68  // Perform a linear search for the tag.
69  for (typename map_t::value_type current_tag : Instance().tagMap_) {
70  if (current_tag.second == handle) {
71  return current_tag.first;
72  }
73  }
74  return tag;
75 }
76 
77 // Class functions used for timing.
78 Timer::Timer(size_t handle, bool constructStopped)
79  : timing_(false), handle_(handle) {
80  if (!constructStopped) Start();
81 }
82 
83 Timer::Timer(std::string const& tag, bool constructStopped)
84  : timing_(false), handle_(Timing::GetHandle(tag)) {
85  if (!constructStopped) Start();
86 }
87 
88 Timer::~Timer() {
89  if (IsTiming()) Stop();
90 }
91 
92 void Timer::Start() {
93  timing_ = true;
94  time_ = std::chrono::system_clock::now();
95 }
96 
97 void Timer::Stop() {
98  std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::system_clock> now =
99  std::chrono::system_clock::now();
100  double dt =
101  static_cast<double>(
102  std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::nanoseconds>(now - time_)
103  .count()) *
104  kNumSecondsPerNanosecond;
105 
106  Timing::Instance().AddTime(handle_, dt);
107  timing_ = false;
108 }
109 
110 bool Timer::IsTiming() const { return timing_; }
111 
112 void Timing::AddTime(size_t handle, double seconds) {
113  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(Instance().mutex_);
114  timers_[handle].acc_.Add(seconds);
115 }
116 
117 double Timing::GetTotalSeconds(size_t handle) {
118  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(Instance().mutex_);
119  return Instance().timers_[handle].acc_.Sum();
120 }
121 double Timing::GetTotalSeconds(std::string const& tag) {
122  return GetTotalSeconds(GetHandle(tag));
123 }
124 double Timing::GetMeanSeconds(size_t handle) {
125  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(Instance().mutex_);
126  return Instance().timers_[handle].acc_.Mean();
127 }
128 double Timing::GetMeanSeconds(std::string const& tag) {
129  return GetMeanSeconds(GetHandle(tag));
130 }
131 size_t Timing::GetNumSamples(size_t handle) {
132  return Instance().timers_[handle].acc_.TotalSamples();
133 }
134 size_t Timing::GetNumSamples(std::string const& tag) {
135  return GetNumSamples(GetHandle(tag));
136 }
137 double Timing::GetVarianceSeconds(size_t handle) {
138  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(Instance().mutex_);
139  return Instance().timers_[handle].acc_.LazyVariance();
140 }
141 double Timing::GetVarianceSeconds(std::string const& tag) {
142  return GetVarianceSeconds(GetHandle(tag));
143 }
144 double Timing::GetMinSeconds(size_t handle) {
145  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(Instance().mutex_);
146  return Instance().timers_[handle].acc_.Min();
147 }
148 double Timing::GetMinSeconds(std::string const& tag) {
149  return GetMinSeconds(GetHandle(tag));
150 }
151 double Timing::GetMaxSeconds(size_t handle) {
152  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(Instance().mutex_);
153  return Instance().timers_[handle].acc_.Max();
154 }
155 double Timing::GetMaxSeconds(std::string const& tag) {
156  return GetMaxSeconds(GetHandle(tag));
157 }
158 
159 double Timing::GetHz(size_t handle) {
160  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(Instance().mutex_);
161  const double rolling_mean = Instance().timers_[handle].acc_.RollingMean();
162  CHECK_GT(rolling_mean, 0.0);
163  return 1.0 / rolling_mean;
164 }
165 
166 double Timing::GetHz(std::string const& tag) { return GetHz(GetHandle(tag)); }
167 
168 std::string Timing::SecondsToTimeString(double seconds) {
169  char buffer[256];
170  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), "%09.6f", seconds);
171  return buffer;
172 }
173 
174 void Timing::Print(std::ostream& out) {
175  map_t& tagMap = Instance().tagMap_;
176 
177  if (tagMap.empty()) {
178  return;
179  }
180 
181  out << "SM Timing\n";
182  out << "-----------\n";
183  for (typename map_t::value_type t : tagMap) {
184  size_t i = t.second;
185  out.width((std::streamsize)Instance().maxTagLength_);
186  out.setf(std::ios::left, std::ios::adjustfield);
187  out << t.first << "\t";
188  out.width(7);
189 
190  out.setf(std::ios::right, std::ios::adjustfield);
191  out << GetNumSamples(i) << "\t";
192  if (GetNumSamples(i) > 0) {
193  out << SecondsToTimeString(GetTotalSeconds(i)) << "\t";
194  double meansec = GetMeanSeconds(i);
195  double stddev = sqrt(GetVarianceSeconds(i));
196  out << "(" << SecondsToTimeString(meansec) << " +- ";
197  out << SecondsToTimeString(stddev) << ")\t";
198 
199  double minsec = GetMinSeconds(i);
200  double maxsec = GetMaxSeconds(i);
201 
202  // The min or max are out of bounds.
203  out << "[" << SecondsToTimeString(minsec) << ","
204  << SecondsToTimeString(maxsec) << "]";
205  }
206  out << std::endl;
207  }
208 }
209 std::string Timing::Print() {
210  std::stringstream ss;
211  Print(ss);
212  return ss.str();
213 }
214 
215 void Timing::Reset() {
216  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(Instance().mutex_);
217  Instance().tagMap_.clear();
218 }
219 
220 } // namespace timing
221 } // namespace voxblox
